sub_ports.name: Albany
sub_ports.comments:
1. THE FOLLOWING ICE INFORMATION BROADCAST HAS BEEN INITIATED:

ICE REPORT FOR NEW YORK HARBOR AND HUDSON RIVER:



2. LOCATION: TYPE/FORM/THICKNESS/COVERAGE/ESTABLISHED TRACK (Y OR N)/DATE

A. SHREWSBURY/NAVESINK: PLATE, 3-5 INCHES, 100%,

B. SANDY HOOK BAY: BRASH/PLATE, 3 INCHES, 80%

C. LOWER NEW YORK BAY: PLATE, 3 INCHES, 20%

D. UPPER NEW YORK BAY: BRASH/PLATE, 1-3 INCHES, 15%

E. NEWARK BAY: PLATE, 2 INCHES, 30%

F. THROGS NECK BRIDGE: OPEN

G. GEORGE WASHINGTON BRIDGE: DRIFT/PLATE/BRASH, 1-3 INCHES, 35%

H. TAPPAN ZEE TO WEST POINT: DRIFT/PLATE/BRASH, 2-3 INCHES, 40%

I. WEST POINT TO NEWBURGH: DRIFT/FAST, 8-12 INCHES, 95%

J. NEWBURGH TO POUGHKEEPSIE: DRIFT/PLATE/BRASH, 6-9 INCHES, 85%

K. POUGHKEEPSIE TO KINGSTON: CAKE, 5-6 INCHES, 85%

L. KINGSTON TO CATSKILL: PLATE, 6-8 INCHES, 100%

M. CATSKILL TO ALBANY: PLATE/BRASH, 6-8 INCHES, 100%

N. ALBANY TO TROY: PLATE, 7-8 INCHES, 100%

O. OTHER PORT OF ALBANY: PLATE/BRASH/FRAZIL, 4-5 INCHES, 100%



3. THE CURRENT CONDITIONS OF THE FOLLOWING MEETING AREAS AND CHOKEPOINTS:

A. WEST POINT: DRIFT/FAST, 8-12 INCHES, 100%,

B. STORM KING: BRASH/PLATE, 8+ INCHES, 100%

C. CRUM ELBOW: DRIFT/FAST, 5-6 INCHES, 95%

D. HYDE PARK:  CAKE, 5-6 INCHES, 95%

E. ESOPUS MEADOWS: FAST/BRASH, 6 INCHES, 75%

F. SILVER POINT: PLATE, 6-8 INCHES, 100%

G. HUDSON ANCHORAGE: PLATE, 6-8 INCHES, 100%

H. STUYVESANT ANCHORAGE: PLATE, 4-8 INCHES, 100%



4. PENDING ATON DISCREPANCIES:

A) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 84 has been re-names Hudson River Lighted Buoy 86A.

B) Wanton Island Sector Light is extinguished.

C) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 52 is extinguished.

D) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 59 is extinguished.

E) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 74 is extinguished.

F) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 89 is extinguished.

G) Hudson River Shoal Lighted Buoy A is extinguished.

H) Hudson River Shoal Lighted Buoy B is extinguished.

I) Hogs Back North Lighted Buoy 35 is extinguished.

J) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 94 is extinguished.

K) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 98 is extinguished.

L) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 117 is extinguished.

M) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 119 is extinguished.

N) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 154 is extinguished.

O) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 4 is extinguished.

P) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 15 is off-station and extinguished.

Q) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 18 is off-station.

R) Morris Canal Entrance Buoy 1 is off-station.



5. OPERATING RESTRICTIONS: VESSELS OF LESS THAN 3,000 HP ENGAGED IN TOWING OPERATIONS ARE NOT AUTHORITIZED TO TRANSIT THE HUDSON RIVER BETWEEN THE TAPPAN ZEE/GOVERNOR CUOMO BRIDGE AND DUNN MEMORIAL BRIDGE UNLESS SPECIFICIALLY AUTHORIZED BY THE COTP NEW YORK. VESSELS SEEKING TO TRANSIT THIS AREA CAN CONTACT THE VESSEL TRAFFIC SERVICE AT (718) 354-4088



6. THESE ICE CONDITIONS ARE ESTIMATED AND MAY BE WORSE IN NATURAL CHOKE POINTS AND OUTSIDE THE NAVIGABLE TRACK MAINTAINED BY COAST GUARD ICEBREAKERS. DAILY ICE REPORTS, OVER FLIGHT PICTURES, AND ADDITIONAL ICE RELATED INFORMATION CAN BE FOUND AT THE SECTOR NEW YORK HOMEPORT WEBSITE. SECTOR NEW YORK CAN BE REACHED AT 718-354-4356.





POC: SECTOR NEW YORK SU DESK 718-354-4356

sub_ports.name: CHESAPEAKE & DELAWARE CANAL (FROM DELAWARE RIVER ENTRANCE TO DELAWARE/MARYLAND STATELINE)
sub_ports.comments: Open with Restrictions - * Ref MSIB 08-26 - The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers prescribes a steel hull and 2,500 minimum shaft horsepower for the C&D Canal. Transits are permissible for all vessels with a steel hull and at least 1,500 minimum shaft horsepower, only when following a 2,500 minimum shaft horsepower (or greater) vessel. The canal dispatcher on duty should be contacted regarding conditions and requirements for vessels using the C&D Canal at (410) 855-5580.

sub_ports.name: DE COAST AND DE ICW
sub_ports.comments: Open with Restrictions - Set Winter Port Condition 2 * MSIB 05-26 The Captain of the Port (COTP), Sector Delaware Bay has set Winter Port Condition Two due to the formation of ice of appreciable thickness and coverage in the navigable waters of the Delaware Bay and River, Chesapeake and Delaware (C&D) Canal, Cape May Harbor and Canal, New Jersey Intracoastal Waterway, and Delaware Shore.

sub_ports.name: DELAWARE BAY (INCLUDING THEIR TRIBUTARIES)
sub_ports.comments: Open with Restrictions - Set Ice Condition 1 * Ref MSIB 08-26 - The COTP, Sector Delaware Bay has set Ice Condition One for all waters of the Delaware Bay, south of Artificial Island to the entrance of the Delaware Bay. The following restrictions are in effect: only steel hull vessels are allowed to enter, operate in, or transit the Delaware Bay.

sub_ports.name: DELAWARE RIVER (INCLUDING THEIR TRIBUTARIES)
sub_ports.comments:
Open with Restrictions – Set Ice Conditions Three and Two *Ref MSIB 08-26 – The COTP, Sector Delaware Bay has set Ice Condition Three for all navigable waters of the Upper Delaware River, north of the Betsy Ross Bridge. The following restrictions are in effect: only steel hull vessels with a 1,500 minimum shaft horsepower and a main engine cooling system design that prevents blockage from ice, and that are part of a vessel convoy, may enter, operate in, or transit the Upper Delaware River. Also, vessels may only transit during daylight hours.

The COTP, Sector Delaware Bay has set Ice Condition Two for all navigable waters of the Delaware River, south of the Betsy Ross Bridge to Artificial Island, in New Jersey, including the navigable waters of the Schuylkill River, Salem River, and Christina River.  The following restrictions are in effect: only steel hull vessels with 1,500 minimum shaft horsepower and a main engine cooling system design that prevents blockage from ice, may enter, operate in, or transit through the Delaware River, Schuylkill River, Salem River, and Christina River.

sub_ports.name: NJ COAST AND NJ ICW
sub_ports.comments: Open with Restrictions - Set Ice Condition 2 * Ref MSIB 08-26 - The COTP, Sector Delaware Bay has set Ice Condition Two for all waters of the New Jersey Intracoastal Waterway, including all tributaries. The following restrictions are in effect: only steel hull vessels with 1,500 minimum shaft horsepower and a main engine cooling system design that prevents blockage from ice, may enter, operate in, or transit through the New Jersey Intracoastal Waterway, including all tributaries.

sub_ports.name: BALTIMORE
sub_ports.comments: Open w/Restrictions: Ice Condition One set for Zones 3 & 5 Only steel hull vessels are allowed to enter, operate in, or transit. Ice Condition Two set for Zone 1 Only steel hull vessels with a minimum of 1500HP are allowed to enter, operate in, or transit. Refer to 33 CFR 165.550 for Zone Boundaries. MSIB 04-26 UPDATE 03.

sub_ports.name: SALISBURY
sub_ports.comments: Open w/Restrictions: Ice Condition Two set for Wicomico River and Tangier Sound. Only steel hull vessels with a minimum of 1500HP are allowed to enter, operate in, or transit. Ice Condition One set for remainder of Zone 4 Only steel hull vessels are allowed to enter, operate in, or transit. Refer to 33 CFR 165.550 for Zone Boundaries. MSIB 04-26 UPDATE 03.

sub_ports.name: WASHINGTON
sub_ports.comments: Open w/Restrictions: Ice Condition Two set for Zone 6 Only steel hull vessels with a minimum of 1500HP are allowed to enter, operate in, or transit. Ice Condition One set for Zone 5 Only steel hull vessels are allowed to enter, operate in, or transit. Refer to 33 CFR 165.550 for Zone Boundaries. MSIB 04-26 UPDATE 03.

Port Condition RECOVERY will be effective 06:00 p.m. February 7. Open to marine traffic, conditions permitting and withstanding adverse reports, marine traffic must maintain heightened vigilance for any hazards.

Winter Port Condition Two (MSIB 011-26) IAW 33CFR165.550, vessels are required to meet specific ice restrictions to operate.

Vessels must have the proper hull type and an adequate propulsion system meeting the minimum horsepower requirements imposed.

M) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 119 is extinguished.

N) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 154 is extinguished.

O) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 4 is extinguished.

P) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 15 is off-station and extinguished.

Q) Hudson River Lighted Buoy 18 is off-station.

R) Morris Canal Entrance Buoy 1 is off-station.



5. OPERATING RESTRICTIONS: VESSELS OF LESS THAN 3,000 HP ENGAGED IN TOWING OPERATIONS ARE NOT AUTHORITIZED TO TRANSIT THE HUDSON RIVER BETWEEN THE TAPPAN ZEE/GOVERNOR CUOMO BRIDGE AND DUNN MEMORIAL BRIDGE UNLESS SPECIFICIALLY AUTHORIZED BY THE COTP NEW YORK. VESSELS SEEKING TO TRANSIT THIS AREA CAN CONTACT THE VESSEL TRAFFIC SERVICE AT (718) 354-4088



6. THESE ICE CONDITIONS ARE ESTIMATED AND MAY BE WORSE IN NATURAL CHOKE POINTS AND OUTSIDE THE NAVIGABLE TRACK MAINTAINED BY COAST GUARD ICEBREAKERS. DAILY ICE REPORTS, OVER FLIGHT PICTURES, AND ADDITIONAL ICE RELATED INFORMATION CAN BE FOUND AT THE SECTOR NEW YORK HOMEPORT WEBSITE. SECTOR NEW YORK CAN BE REACHED AT 718-354-4356.





POC: SECTOR NEW YORK SU DESK 718-354-4356

Winter Port Condition Two (MSIB 011-26) IAW 33CFR165.550, vessels are required to meet specific ice restrictions to operate.

Vessels must have the proper hull type and an adequate propulsion system meeting the minimum horsepower requirements imposed.
